summary: This is an email chain from July 25, 2019, forwarding a report from the Bureau of Prisons about Jeffrey Epstein being found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck on the morning of July 24, 2019. He was placed on suicide watch, and his cellmate reportedly threatened to kill him. The incident is under investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck, placed on suicide watch, and his cellmate reportedly threatened to kill him.

persons.name: Associate Warden
persons.role: Associate Warden at MCC New York
persons.context: Advised the reporting party about the incident involving Jeffrey Epstein being found in his cell with a noose and the threat from his cellmate.

persons.name: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal Southern District of New York
persons.context: Sent the initial report about the incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York.

connections.description: The Associate Warden at MCC New York reported on Epstein's condition and the incident in his cell.

connections.person2: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal Southern District of New York
connections.description: The Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal relayed the report about Epstein's incident at the prison.

events.title: Epstein Found with Noose in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York at 0127 hours in a fetal position with a noose around his neck. He was escorted to medical, assessed, initially placed on suicide watch, and subsequently downgraded to suicide observation.

events.title: Cellmate Threat Reported
events.description: Epstein's cellmate reported being threatened to be killed, according to the Associate Warden's report.

events.title: Email Forwarding Incident Report
events.description: An email was sent forwarding the Bureau of Prisons report about the incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York.
personsInvolved: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal Southern District of New York

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York on July 24, 2019, at 0127 hours with a noose around his neck.
Epstein was initially placed on suicide watch and then downgraded to suicide observation following the incident.
Epstein's cellmate reported being threatened to be killed, according to the Associate Warden's report.
The incident is under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons.
The email highlights the 'noose' as a new detail not previously heard by the recipient.
